1. Product name: This is the application's name. It should always and only link the user
to the product's home page.
2. Header links: Also known as tabs, these are supported only for internal product
navigation. These links should not open a new tab or link to an external place.
3. Utilities: The Header provides a home for global system-level utilities from anywhere
on the site. Utility icons should not be used to directly navigate to an area. Instead, they
should open a panel that provides access to other areas of the product.
4. Profile access: The Avatar can be a text, two capital letters corresponding to the
initials of the co-worker or an image. It provides access to a side panel with the Profile
component and its details.
5. App Switcher icon: A way to navigate easily between products and systems.
Recommended uses for this component include recently used apps, frequently used
apps, or all apps attached to the user's account. If the list has a manageable size,
include all apps or products available on the system.
Responsive layout
The Ingka Co-worker Design Subsystem uses spacing, grids and breakpoints standards
from Skapa. Please read here if you are looking for general information about them.
Large breakpoints
The Header is configurable to allow a product or platform to choose a configuration
that matches its information architecture. You can choose between a header with links
or a vertical menu/hamburger menu that opens a side panel. The Header is globally
persistent and will always be in view as the user navigates around the application.

Small and medium breakpoints
In specific use cases for small and medium breakpoints, there is also an option of using
a Bottom Bar Navigation. A Bottom Bar Navigation is a user interface element typically
used in mobile apps to display navigational options. It appears at the bottom of the
screen and can contain icons with labels. The Bottom Bar allows users to quickly switch
between different areas of the application and perform common actions.

Product name size
There are two sizes for Product name: Default and Large. Default
size is for the long product names. Large size is for the product
names which are very short and need to stand out, e.g Hejl.
The main navigation can consist of header links, a Hamburger Menu, or a Bottom Bar.
Tabs are not allowed to overflow, and will automatically convert into a Hamburger Menu
when they reach a size where the content no longer fits.
For products that are more mobile-focused, there is the option for a Bottom Bar
Navigation. The Bottom Bar Navigation should never be combined with a Hamburger
Menu.

Accessibility
Keyboard Interactions
Each element in the header can be reached by the Tab key. A “Skip to main content”
button appears when a keyboard user first tabs into the page. Links and icons can be
activated by Enter. Icons can also be activated by pressing Space.
IX
Pressing the Tab key reveals a 'Skip to main’ button and then moves between other header elements. The numbers indicate the order of the keyboard interaction.
Landmarks
Ingka Co-worker Design applies a header landmark around the Global Header. This help
people who use assistive technology to make a mental model of a screen's content.
Labelling
The accessibility label for a navigation item is typically the same as the destination
name. If the Ul text is properly linked, assistive technologies like screen readers will
read the Ul text first, followed by the role of the component.
